page.title: 09Pontefract Castle.
page.content: Now in ruins Pontefract Castle was once one of the most important castles in the north. Built on solid rock, with a sheer drop to the north and a deep dry moat, it gives extensive views to the north and east. still to be seen are the bases of seven, towers,the gatehouse and connecting walls, as well as the layout of the bakehouse with round beehive ovens, and the buttery. Recently rubble and vegetation was cleared and stone work cleaned and pointed.Steps to the top of the were revealed.The outline of the Norman Chapelcan now clearly be seen.The Castle grounds make a popular walkingarea for young and old,school parties can frequently be seen investigating the ruins.Under the lawn is the magazine used as a dungeon in the sieges. Wayne Chapman.
